Articles.Content: I always like to have a general rule of thumb when sending kerbals on long missions with regards to living space. In other words, I don't like stuffing one kerbal in a mk 1 command pod and them sending them off to eeloo. So I did some research and now know the real life requirements, but I got stuck in an unexpected place, I can't find the interior volume of habitable parts in KSP. I would like to know if anyone else knows, but if not it might be a "fun" community project to try to find them all out using the size of the capsule and where the windows match up or something.
The PPD-10 is about 13.73 cubic meters in volume.
That makes sense to me, did you find it somewhere or did you calculate it?
Calculated. Using 2 different Rockomax tanks for scale.
did you take into account that the interior is hexagonal? That's going to be the tricky thing about this, the volume of the part is not all necessarily living space.
Well, it counts as available space [storage] or hollow space to be technical.
